thread.title: High school football video: Pine View snaps three-game skid with win over Murray
thread.title_full: High school football video: Pine View snaps three-game skid with win over Murray | Deseret News

title: High school football video: Pine View snaps three-game skid with win over Murray
text:
On Wednesday night, Pine View used a late third-quarter surge to push past Murray 20-10.
More Coverage High school football roundup for Wednesday, Oct. 14 High school football: Bingham's offense proves big point, and points, in high-scoring win over Jordan High school football: Defense leads the way for Pleasant Grove in a 34-2 win over Westlake MURRAY — Often in football, long days of travel can lead to sluggish performances on the field. So when Pine View made the drive up from St. George to take on Murray on Wednesday night, no one would have blamed them for having somewhat of a letdown game.
But the opposite happened, as the Panthers overcame two first-half interceptions from quarterback Riley Livingston to come out on top over the Spartans 20-10.
Those interceptions almost proved to be costly for Livingston and company. One of them, specifically, came in the red zone when the Panthers were looking to put some distance in between themselves and the Spartans early on.
Luckily for Pine View, Murray couldn’t capitalize on said turnovers. This kept the game close, but with the help of 100-plus yards on the ground from running back Kobe Topalain, the Panthers stayed afloat until the end of the third quarter when they really turned things on.
Shortly after Livingston dropped a 35-yard beauty of a pass to receiver Steve Bangerter that put Pine View up 17-7, the defense stepped up in a big way by forcing a fumble. A Panther quickly pounced on it, forcing another turnover and giving Pine View the ball right before the third quarter ended.
A field goal from both sides filled the fourth quarter to push the score to the final of 20-10.
